dcc:administrativeData.dcc:statementP1: The reported measurement result relates only to the measurand and applies only at the time of measurement.
dcc:administrativeData.dcc:statementP2: This calibration certificate may not be reproduced other than in full except with the permission of the Ionizing Radiation Metrology Laboratory, OAP.

dcc:measurementResults.dcc:influenceCondition: The measurement was carried out in an ambient temperature of (20.0 ± 2) ˚C, air pressure (96.0 ±10) kPa and relative humidity (55 ± 20) %
dcc:measurementResults.dcc:measurementMethod: Calibration in a known radiation field. The reference air kerma rates are from collimated beams of Cobalt - 60 and Caesium - 137 irradiators.
dcc:measurementResults.dcc:measurementOfLength: The UUC reading is averaged from the readings without adjustment, unless UUC before adjustment is reported. The calibration factor (C.F.) is defined as the standard of the quantity that the instrument is intended to measure divided by the UUC reading given by the instrument. To achieve more accuracy, C.F. shall be applied using the equation; result = C.F. x UUC reading. The conversion coefficient of R to Gy is 8.76 mGy/R (ref. ICRU Report 47 p.23.). The conversion coefficient of Gy to Sv is 1.21 Sv/Gy for Cs-137 and 1.16 Sv/Gy for Co-60 (ref. ISO 4037-3 p.26).
dcc:measurementResults.dcc:uncertainty: The stated uncertainty is the expanded uncertainty which obtains multiplying of the standard uncertainty and the coverage factor k=2 at approximately 95% confidence. It has been determined in accordance with Guide to the Expression of Uncertainty in Measurement - JCGM 100: 2008.
dcc:measurementResults.dcc:traceability: The calibration is traceable to the National Metrology Institute of Japan (NMIJ), through Certificate Reference No. 212020.
dcc:measurementResults.dcc:statementP3: *The reference condition of the calibration coefficient stated 293.15 K of temperature and 101.325 kPa of pressure.
